8.verse: The Bronze Bowl - He made the bronze bowl for washing, and he built it on a bronze stand. He used the bronze from mirrors that belonged to the women who served at the entrance to the Meeting Tent.

9.verse: The Courtyard of the Holy Tent - Then he made a wall of curtains to form a courtyard around the Holy Tent. On the south side the curtains were one hundred fifty feet long and were made of fine linen.

10.verse: The curtains hung on silver hooks and bands, placed on twenty bronze posts with twenty bronze bases.

11.verse: On the north side the wall of curtains was also one hundred fifty feet long, and it hung on silver hooks and bands on twenty posts with twenty bronze bases.

12.verse: On the west side of the courtyard, the wall of curtains was seventy-five feet long. It was held up by silver hooks and bands on ten posts with ten bases.

13.verse: The east side was also seventy-five feet long.

14.verse: On one side of the entry there was a wall of curtains twenty-two and one-half feet long, held up by three posts and three bases.

15.verse: On the other side of the entry there was also a wall of curtains twenty-two and one-half feet long, held up by three posts and three bases.

16.verse: All the curtains around the courtyard were made of fine linen.

17.verse: The bases for the posts were made of bronze. The hooks and the bands on the posts were made of silver, and the tops of the posts were covered with silver also. All the posts in the courtyard had silver bands.

18.verse: The curtain for the entry of the courtyard was made of blue, purple, and red thread, and fine linen, sewn by a person who could sew well. The curtain was thirty feet long and seven and one-half feet high, the same height as the curtains around the courtyard.

19.verse: It was held up by four posts and four bronze bases. The hooks and bands on the posts were made of silver, and the tops on the posts were covered with silver.

20.verse: All the tent pegs for the Holy Tent and for the curtains around the courtyard were made of bronze.

21.verse: This is a list of the materials used to make the Holy Tent, where the Agreement was kept. Moses ordered the Levites to make this list, and Ithamar son of Aaron was in charge of keeping it.

22.verse: Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur of the tribe of Judah, made everything the LORD commanded Moses.

23.verse: Oholiab son of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan helped him. He could cut designs into metal and stone; he was a designer and also skilled at sewing the blue, purple, and red thread, and fine linen.

24.verse: The total amount of gold used to build the Holy Tent was presented to the LORD. It weighed over 2,000 pounds, as set by the Holy Place measure.

25.verse: The silver was given by the members of the community who were counted. It weighed 7,550 pounds, as set by the Holy Place measure.

26.verse: All the men twenty years old or older were counted. There were 603,550 men, and each man had to pay one-fifth of an ounce of silver, as set by the Holy Place measure.

27.verse: Of this silver, 7,500 pounds were used to make the one hundred bases for the Holy Tent and for the curtain—75 pounds of silver in each base.

28.verse: They used 50 pounds of silver to make the hooks for the posts and to cover the tops of the posts and to make the bands on them.

29.verse: The bronze which was presented to the LORD weighed about 5,000 pounds.

30.verse: They used the bronze to make the bases at the entrance of the Meeting Tent, to make the altar and the bronze screen, and to make all the tools for the altar.

31.verse: This bronze was also used to make bases for the wall of curtains around the courtyard and bases for curtains at the entry to the courtyard, as well as to make the tent pegs for the Holy Tent and the curtains that surrounded the courtyard.

1.verse: Clothes for the Priests - They used blue, purple, and red thread to make woven clothes for the priests to wear when they served in the Holy Place. They made the holy clothes for Aaron as the LORD had commanded Moses.

2.verse: They made the holy vest of gold, and blue, purple, and red thread, and fine linen.

3.verse: They hammered the gold into sheets and then cut it into long, thin strips. They worked the gold into the blue, purple, and red thread, and fine linen. This was done by skilled craftsmen.

4.verse: They made the shoulder straps for the holy vest, which were attached to the top corners of the vest and tied together over each shoulder.

5.verse: The skillfully woven belt was made in the same way; it was joined to the holy vest as one piece. It was made of gold, and blue, purple, and red thread, and fine linen, the way the LORD commanded Moses.

6.verse: They put gold around the onyx stones and then wrote the names of the sons of Israel on these gems, as a person carves words and designs on a seal.

7.verse: Then they attached the gems on the shoulder straps of the holy vest, as reminders of the twelve sons of Israel. This was done just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

8.verse: The skilled craftsmen made the chest covering like the holy vest; it was made of gold, and blue, purple, and red thread, and fine linen.

9.verse: The chest covering was square—nine inches long and nine inches wide—and it was folded double to make a pocket.

10.verse: Then they put four rows of beautiful jewels on it: In the first row there was a ruby, a topaz, and a yellow quartz;

11.verse: in the second there was a turquoise, a sapphire, and an emerald;

12.verse: in the third there was a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;

13.verse: in the fourth there was a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper. Gold was put around these jewels to attach them to the chest covering,

14.verse: and the names of the sons of Israel were carved on these twelve jewels as a person carves a seal. Each jewel had the name of one of the twelve tribes of Israel.

15.verse: They made chains of pure gold, twisted together like a rope, for the chest covering.

16.verse: The workers made two gold pieces and two gold rings. They put the two gold rings on the two upper corners of the chest covering.

17.verse: Then they put two gold chains in the two rings at the ends of the chest covering,

18.verse: and they fastened the other two ends of the chains to the two gold pieces. They attached these gold pieces to the two shoulder straps in the front of the holy vest.

19.verse: They made two gold rings and put them at the lower corners of the chest covering on the inside edge next to the holy vest.

20.verse: They made two more gold rings on the bottom of the shoulder straps in front of the holy vest, near the seam, just above the woven belt of the holy vest.

21.verse: They used a blue ribbon and tied the rings of the chest covering to the rings of the holy vest, connecting it to the woven belt. In this way the chest covering would not swing out from the holy vest. They did all these things the way the LORD commanded.

22.verse: Then they made the outer robe to be worn under the holy vest. It was woven only of blue cloth.

23.verse: They made a hole in the center of the outer robe, with a woven collar sewn around it so it would not tear.

24.verse: Then they made balls like pomegranates of blue, purple, and red thread, and fine linen and hung them around the bottom of the outer robe.

25.verse: They also made bells of pure gold and hung these around the bottom of the outer robe between the balls.

26.verse: So around the bottom of the outer robe there was a bell and a pomegranate ball, a bell and a pomegranate ball. The priest wore this outer robe when he served as priest, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

27.verse: They wove inner robes of fine linen for Aaron and his sons,

28.verse: and they made turbans, headbands, and underclothes of fine linen.

29.verse: Then they made the cloth belt of fine linen, and blue, purple, and red thread, and designs were sewn onto it, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

30.verse: They made a strip of pure gold, which is the holy crown, and carved these words in the gold, as one might carve on a seal: “Holy to the LORD.”

31.verse: Then they tied this flat piece to the turban with a blue ribbon, as the LORD had commanded Moses.

32.verse: So all the work on the Meeting Tent was finished. The Israelites did everything just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

33.verse: Then they brought the Holy Tent to Moses: the Tent and all its furniture, hooks, frames, crossbars, posts, and bases;

34.verse: the covering made of male sheepskins colored red, the covering made of fine leather, and the curtain that covered the entrance to the Most Holy Place;

35.verse: the Ark of the Agreement, its poles and lid;

36.verse: the table, all its containers, and the bread that showed they were in God’s presence;

37.verse: the pure gold lampstand with its lamps in a row, all its tools, and the olive oil for the light;

38.verse: the gold altar, the special olive oil used for appointing priests, the sweet-smelling incense, and the curtain that covered the entrance to the Tent;

39.verse: the bronze altar and its screen, its poles and all its tools, the bowl and its stand;

40.verse: the curtains for the courtyard with their posts and bases, the curtain that covered the entry to the courtyard, the cords, pegs, and all the things in the Meeting Tent.

41.verse: They brought the clothes for the priests to wear when they served in the Holy Tent—the holy clothes for Aaron the priest and the clothes for his sons, which they wore when they served as priests.

42.verse: The Israelites had done all this work just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

43.verse: Moses looked closely at all the work and saw they had done it just as the LORD had commanded. So Moses blessed them.

1.verse: Setting Up the Holy Tent - Then the LORD said to Moses:

2.verse: “On the first day of the first month, set up the Holy Tent, which is the Meeting Tent.

3.verse: Put the Ark of the Agreement in it and hang the curtain in front of the Ark.

4.verse: Bring in the table and arrange everything on the table that should be there. Then bring in the lampstand and set up its lamps.

5.verse: Put the gold altar for burning incense in front of the Ark of the Agreement, and put the curtain at the entrance to the Holy Tent.

6.verse: “Put the altar of burnt offerings in front of the entrance of the Holy Tent, the Meeting Tent.

7.verse: Put the bowl between the Meeting Tent and the altar, and put water in it.

8.verse: Set up the courtyard around the Holy Tent, and put the curtain at the entry to the courtyard.

9.verse: “Use the special olive oil and pour it on the Holy Tent and everything in it, in order to give the Tent and all that is in it for service to the LORD. They will be holy.

10.verse: Pour the special oil on the altar for burnt offerings and on all its tools. Give the altar for service to God, and it will be very holy.

11.verse: Then pour the special olive oil on the bowl and the base under it so that they will be given for service to God.

12.verse: “Bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the Meeting Tent, and wash them with water.

13.verse: Then put the holy clothes on Aaron. Pour the special oil on him, and give him for service to God so that he may serve me as a priest.

14.verse: Bring Aaron’s sons and put the inner robes on them.

15.verse: Pour the special oil on them in the same way that you appointed their father as priest so that they may also serve me as priests. Pouring oil on them will make them a family of priests, they and their descendants from now on.”

16.verse: Moses did everything that the LORD commanded him.

17.verse: So the Holy Tent was set up on the first day of the first month during the second year after they left Egypt.

18.verse: When Moses set up the Holy Tent, he put the bases in place, and he put the frames on the bases. Next he put the crossbars through the rings of the frames and set up the posts.

19.verse: After that, Moses spread the cloth over the Holy Tent and put the covering over it, just as the LORD commanded.

20.verse: Moses put the stone tablets that had the Agreement written on them into the Ark. He put the poles through the rings of the Ark and put the lid on it.

21.verse: Next he brought the Ark into the Tent and hung the curtain to cover the Ark, just as the LORD commanded him.

22.verse: Moses put the table in the Meeting Tent on the north side of the Holy Tent in front of the curtain.

23.verse: Then he put the bread on the table before the LORD, just as the LORD commanded him.

24.verse: Moses put the lampstand in the Meeting Tent on the south side of the Holy Tent across from the table.

25.verse: Then he put the lamps on the lampstand before the LORD, just as the LORD commanded him.

26.verse: Moses put the gold altar for burning incense in the Meeting Tent in front of the curtain.

27.verse: Then he burned sweet-smelling incense on it, just as the LORD commanded him.

28.verse: Then he hung the curtain at the entrance to the Holy Tent.

29.verse: He put the altar for burnt offerings at the entrance to the Holy Tent, the Meeting Tent, and offered a whole burnt offering and grain offerings on it, just as the LORD commanded him.

30.verse: Moses put the bowl between the Meeting Tent and the altar for burnt offerings, and he put water in it for washing.

31.verse: Moses, Aaron, and Aaron’s sons used this water to wash their hands and feet.

32.verse: They washed themselves every time they entered the Meeting Tent and every time they went near the altar for burnt offerings, just as the LORD commanded Moses.

33.verse: Then Moses set up the courtyard around the Holy Tent and the altar, and he put up the curtain at the entry to the courtyard. So Moses finished the work.

34.verse: The Cloud over the Holy Tent - Then the cloud covered the Meeting Tent, and the glory of the LORD filled the Holy Tent.

35.verse: Moses could not enter the Meeting Tent, because the cloud had settled on it, and the glory of the LORD filled the Holy Tent.

36.verse: When the cloud rose from the Holy Tent, the Israelites would begin to travel,

37.verse: but as long as the cloud stayed on the Holy Tent, they did not travel. They stayed in that place until the cloud rose.

38.verse: So the cloud of the LORD was over the Holy Tent during the day, and there was a fire in the cloud at night. So all the Israelites could see the cloud while they traveled.
